item.title: Removing unneeded sprites from cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So, I’ve removed components from my client, so the only gameframe being used is the 525.
Now, I’ve got most of the extra sprites removed from the gameframe folder. I just need some help getting editing it in the client.java so it only loads 1 image, instead of 3 or 4.

Here’s my loadextrasprites void:

	public void loadExtraSprites(){
		magicAuto = new Sprite("Misc/magicAuto");
		sprite1 = new Sprite("Gameframe/sprite1");
		xpFlag = new Sprite("Gameframe/xpFlag");
		for(int i = 1; i <= 17; i++) {
			ORBS[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Orbs/ORBS "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 4;i++) {
			LOGOUT[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Orbs/X "+i+"");
		}
		for (int j3 = 0; j3 <= 26; j3++) {
			LOGIN[j3] = new Sprite("Login/Buttons/BUTTON "+j3+"");
		}
		for (int i = 0; i <= 2; i++) {
			globe[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Globe "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 4; i++){
			chatArea[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Gameframes/chatArea "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 4; i++){
			tabArea[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Gameframes/tabArea "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 4; i++){
			CustomMapback[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Gameframes/Mapback "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 13; i++){
			modIcons[i] = new Sprite("MODICONS/Icon "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 13; i++){
			chatImages[i] = new Sprite("MODICONS/Icon "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i = 0; i <= 4; i++){
			Black[i] = new Sprite("Gameframe/Gameframes/Black "+i+"");
		}
		for(int i4 = 0; i4 < 3; i4++) {
			hitMark[i4] = new Sprite("Player/Hits "+i4+"");
		}
		qc = new Sprite("Gameframe/Quickchat");
	}

I was wondering if it was possible to do something like this:

globe = new Sprite("Gameframe/Globe 0");

and just completly remove the for loop for some of the sprite laoders. Orbs, and some still need the loop.

Read full topic
